[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: RMS supports job posting, application management, screening, interview scheduling, communication, and skill assessments.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: RMS integrates with job boards, email services, applicant tracking systems, and background check platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: RMS provides a web and mobile UI for recruiters, hiring managers, and job seekers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: RMS supports desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: RMS uses REST APIs, authentication protocols, and cloud storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: RMS optimizes storage for job postings, candidate applications, and interview data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: RMS allows job posting, candidate tracking, interview scheduling, and job seeker communication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: RMS customizes job recommendations and hiring workflows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: RMS connects with payroll, HR platforms, and professional networking sites.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 MISSING-TAG2: RMS provides email notifications, messaging, and interview scheduling tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: RMS facilitates job posting, applicant tracking, interview scheduling, candidate assessments, and reporting.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: RMS serves recruiters, hiring managers, job seekers, and HR administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: RMS requires internet access for job search, application submission, and interview scheduling.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: RMS relies on integration with third-party job boards, cloud-based databases, and communication platforms.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 MISSING-TAG1: The Recruitment Management System (RMS) helps recruiters manage job listings, applications, interviews, and hiring while job seekers can search, apply, and track jobs.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall allow recruiters to create and publish job listings with descriptions, qualifications, and application requirements.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall enable job seekers to search, filter, and apply for jobs based on location, salary, and experience.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall support integration with external recruitment services, assessment tools, and social media platforms.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow job seekers to create profiles, upload resumes, submit applications, and receive automated notifications of their job applications (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable recruiters to screen resumes, track applications, schedule interviews, and conduct skills assessments, including customizable pre-screening tests (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for job posting, application tracking, and communication.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process job postings, applications, and notifications within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support secure data encryption for applicant and recruiter information.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with employment data protection regulations and equal hiring practices.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure secure authentication and encrypted data storage.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store job listings, applicant profiles, resumes, interview schedules, and feedback.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests validate job posting, candidate management, and interview workflows.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Recruitment policies, hiring regulations, and HR standards.
